comment.text: This translation key is used to display the phrase "Change owner" in various places throughout the application, including a dialog header and a button. Its purpose is to inform users that they can change the ownership of something. It appears on a "Delete Owner Profile Dialog" and a "Change Portal Owner Dialog".

usage.context:
filter={filter}
 dataTestId="change_portal_owner_people_selector"
 />
 </ModalDialog.Container>
 ) : null}

 <div className="info">
 <Text className="display-name" title={displayName}>

</Text>
 </ModalDialog.Body>
 <ModalDialog.Footer>
 <Button
 key="OwnerChangeBtn"

 primary

 testId="dialog_owner_change_button"

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Sahibi dəyiş' is a literal translation and doesn't fully capture the nuance of 'Change owner'. It implies a change *of* the owner, rather than a change *to* a new owner.

The translation "Փոխել տնօրինողին" (Poxel tnorinorin) while technically meaning 'Change the owner', doesn't quite capture the nuance of 'Change owner' in the context of user interface elements. It sounds overly formal and literal. A more natural translation would emphasize the action of transferring ownership rather than a direct change of the 'owner' as a person.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like "Լրագրավել սեփականատիրոջը" (Lragravel sepakanatiroj) - 'Transfer ownership', or "Սեփականատիրոջ փոփոխություն" (Sepakanatiroj popoxutyun) - 'Ownership change'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "හිමිකරු සංශෝධනය" is understandable, it's a very literal and somewhat formal translation of "Change owner". A more natural and common translation would be something like "හිමිකාරිත්වය වෙනස් කරන්න" or "හිමිකාරිත්වයෙන් ඉවත් කරන්න". The current phrasing sounds awkward in Sinhala.
The Serbian (Cyrillic) translation 'Промени власника' is a literal translation of 'Change owner' but sounds unnatural in Serbian. A more idiomatic translation would be 'Смени власника'.
